s.text: "I know that this report is the result of many long hours of hard work, research, sound study and innovative thought," Gordon said "It is an impressive document that is worthy of the most serious and sustained consideration.
-- Encouraging large and mid-size law firms to support pro bono through sound, written pro bono policies and an annual, quantifiable means of reporting each firm's pro bono commitment.

PHILADELPHIA--(BUSINESS WIRE)--June 29, 2002--Philadelphia lawyers have reason to be proud of their collective "commitment to make legal services available to the poor and needy" in the region but the "justice system still remains closed to many" and much more needs to be done.
-- Making pro bono a part of the culture and fabric of the legal community to dramatically increase participation in the direct representation of the poor and disadvantaged.

PHILADELPHIA--(BUSINESS WIRE)--June 29, 2002--Philadelphia lawyers have reason to be proud of their collective "commitment to make legal services available to the poor and needy" in the region but the "justice system still remains closed to many" and much more needs to be done.
-- Making pro bono a part of the culture and fabric of the legal community to dramatically increase participation in the direct representation of the poor and disadvantaged.
-- Requiring all officers and members of the Board of Governors to take at least one pro bono case during each year of their service to the Association.
-- Requiring all officers and members of the Board of Governors to take at least one pro bono case during each year of their service to the Association.

The Task Force Report has been accepted by the Association's Board of Governors and Chancellor Gordon has appointed a special committee to be chaired by Chancellor-Elect Audrey C. Talley to consider the Report's observations and recommendations and suggest possible action to the Board.
